component.text: Standard ACL to Permit My Network Only
Standard ACL to Deny a Specific Host
Standard ACL to Deny a Specific Subnet
Step 1 Use the access-list global configuration command to create an entry in a standard IPv4 ACL.

Enter the global no access-list access-list-number command to remove the entire ACL. The example statement matches any address that starts with 192.168.10.x. Use the remark option to add a description to your ACL.
Step 2 Use the interface configuration command to select an interface to which to apply the ACL
Step 3 Use the ip access-group interface configuration command to activate the existing ACL on an interface.
To remove an IP ACL from an interface, enter the no ip access-group access-list-number command on the interface. This example activates the standard IPv4 ACL 1 on the interface as an outbound filter.
